Identifier.description: Mouse over the map for a by-pixel legend of a raster.

descriptionFull.title: Mouse over to query underlying datasets. This will read the raw values from a geo-referenced dataset, which can be any bit-depth (8,16,32). You can set up multiple file to return values from.

[Layer_Name].bands: (int) how many bands to query from
[Layer_Name].sigfigs: (int) how many digits after the decimal
[Layer_Name].timeFormat: (str) for formatting injected '{starttime}' and '{endtime}' in url. See syntax in https://d3js.org/d3-time-format#locale_format

Identifier.name: Identifier

components.name: Separated Tool
components.description: If true, this tool will live outside the left-hand toolbar and be independently accessible.

components.name: Justification
components.description: The legend will display on the right side of the screen if set to right, otherwise default to the left side

components.name: Layers
components.description: Only show DEM if associated layer is on.

object.name: Layer Name or UUID
object.description: This is the layer name exactly as it appears in the Layers section in the configuration.

object.name: URL to .tif
object.description: This can be a relative path to a file under the Mission name or a full url path. The former is preferred is the file is large. Can use '{starttime}' and '{endtime}' if the layer is time enabled. If this field is left empty, the Identifier Tool will try to best-match the hovered-over pixel color with this layer's legend (if any).

object.name: Bands
object.description: Number of bands from which to query.

object.name: SigFigs
object.description: Number of significant figures to use after the decimal of returned values.

object.name: Unit
object.description: A string that is appended to your returned value. e.g. ' m' would be appended on a raw value ('41') and show '41 m'. If it was 'm', it would return '41m', without a space.

object.name: Scale Factor
object.description: A number for which to multiply the raw value by for display purposes only. Useful, for instance, if the underlying dataset is in units that are off by factor's of 10 from what's desired to be shown to users.

object.name: Time Format
object.description: A string for formatting the injected '{starttime}' and '{endtime}' in the url. See syntax in https://d3js.org/d3-time-format#locale_format

Layers.description: Hierarchically toggle layers on and off and alter their opacities.

descriptionFull.title: Allows users to toggle on and off layers, download them, filter their features and change some parameters such as opacity.

Layers.name: Layers

components.name: Expanded
components.description: Whether all layer groupings default to being expanded (as opposed to being collapsed).

Legend.description: Show a chart legend that maps colors and symbols to meaning.

descriptionFull.title: A layer can be configured with a legend by pointing its Legend field to a .csv file or by including a JSON legend array into the layer's Raw Variables. The Legend Tool renders symbologies and gradient scales for any properly configured on layer.

Legend.name: Legend

components.name: Separated Tool
components.description: If true, this tool will live outside the left-hand toolbar and be independently accessible.

components.name: Display on Start
components.description: Whether the expanded legend should automatically be displayed on start.

components.name: Justification
components.description: The legend will display on the right side of the screen if set to right, otherwise default to the left side

Info.description: Display the geojson properties field of a clicked feature.

descriptionFull.title: Lists out the geojson properties of any clicked feature. Any clicked feature will open the Info tool and display the data in JSON formatting. Some layer 'kinds' disable opening the Info tool and displaying data automatically, like the 'Waypoints' kind layer.

Info.name: Info

components.name: Sort Alphabetically
components.description: Whether to sort the feature's fields alphabetically instead of listing them in their native order.

Sites.description: A button bar to navigate between various map locations.

descriptionFull.title: A button bar to quickly navigate between preset map locations.

sites.name: (str) Name of site
sites.code: (str) Unique identifier. Can match header layer to toggle it's sublayers

Sites.name: Sites

object.name: Name
object.description: Name of site

object.name: Code
object.description: Unique identifier. Can match header layer to toggle its sublayers.

Isochrone.description: Find the range of locations accessible to an explorer within a given time.

descriptionFull.title: Given a user-defined starting point, render a shaded region where colors indicate minimum travel time or resource expenditure to reach a given location. Hover over the region to view the least costly path from the start to the cursor. Costs are calculated based on selectable and configurable models, which may each require multiple different tilesets as input.

Isochrone.name: Isochrone

components.name: Elevation (DEM)
components.description: Configure DEM data tilesets to be used by the specified models for computations.

object.name: Name
object.description: A unique name.

object.name: Minimum Zoom
object.description: Minimum zoom of the specified tileset.

object.name: Max Native Zoom
object.description: Maximum (native) zoom of the specified tileset.

object.name: Resolution
object.description: Pixel dimension of the side of the tiles in the tileset. Generally a power of 2 between 32 and 256.

object.name: Interpolate Seams
object.description: Because '1bto4b' (the DEM tiling script) generates tiles with matching edges, data loaded and passed to models may have “seams,” or regularly-spaced pairs of identical rows and columns. Depending on the data type and model, these seams may or may not cause inaccurate results. The default behavior of the tool is therefore to attempt to correct these seams.

components.name: Slope
components.description: Configure Slope data tilesets to be used by the specified models for computations.

object.name: Name
object.description: A unique name.

object.name: Minimum Zoom
object.description: Minimum zoom of the specified tileset.

object.name: Max Native Zoom
object.description: Maximum (native) zoom of the specified tileset.

object.name: Resolution
object.description: Pixel dimension of the side of the tiles in the tileset. Generally a power of 2 between 32 and 256.

object.name: Interpolate Seams
object.description: Because '1bto4b' (the DEM tiling script) generates tiles with matching edges, data loaded and passed to models may have “seams,” or regularly-spaced pairs of identical rows and columns. Depending on the data type and model, these seams may or may not cause inaccurate results. The default behavior of the tool is therefore to attempt to correct these seams.

components.name: Obstacle
components.description: Configure Obstacle map data tilesets to be used by the specified models for computations.

object.name: Name
object.description: A unique name.

object.name: Minimum Zoom
object.description: Minimum zoom of the specified tileset.

object.name: Max Native Zoom
object.description: Maximum (native) zoom of the specified tileset.

object.name: Resolution
object.description: Pixel dimension of the side of the tiles in the tileset. Generally a power of 2 between 32 and 256.

object.name: Interpolate Seams
object.description: Because '1bto4b' (the DEM tiling script) generates tiles with matching edges, data loaded and passed to models may have “seams,” or regularly-spaced pairs of identical rows and columns. Depending on the data type and model, these seams may or may not cause inaccurate results. The default behavior of the tool is therefore to attempt to correct these seams.

components.name: Cost
components.description: Configure Cost data tilesets to be used by the specified models for computations.

object.name: Name
object.description: A unique name.

object.name: Minimum Zoom
object.description: Minimum zoom of the specified tileset.

object.name: Max Native Zoom
object.description: Maximum (native) zoom of the specified tileset.

object.name: Resolution
object.description: Pixel dimension of the side of the tiles in the tileset. Generally a power of 2 between 32 and 256.

object.name: Interpolate Seams
object.description: Because '1bto4b' (the DEM tiling script) generates tiles with matching edges, data loaded and passed to models may have “seams,” or regularly-spaced pairs of identical rows and columns. Depending on the data type and model, these seams may or may not cause inaccurate results. The default behavior of the tool is therefore to attempt to correct these seams.

components.name: Shade
components.description: Configure Shade data tilesets to be used by the specified models for computations.

object.name: Name
object.description: A unique name.

object.name: Minimum Zoom
object.description: Minimum zoom of the specified tileset.

object.name: Max Native Zoom
object.description: Maximum (native) zoom of the specified tileset.

object.name: Resolution
object.description: Pixel dimension of the side of the tiles in the tileset. Generally a power of 2 between 32 and 256.

object.name: Interpolate Seams
object.description: Because '1bto4b' (the DEM tiling script) generates tiles with matching edges, data loaded and passed to models may have “seams,” or regularly-spaced pairs of identical rows and columns. Depending on the data type and model, these seams may or may not cause inaccurate results. The default behavior of the tool is therefore to attempt to correct these seams.

components.name: Enabled Models
components.description: Comma-separated list of isochrone models to enable. Possible values are: 'Traverse Time', 'Isodistance', 'Example'

components.name: Interpolate Seams (Global)
components.description: Because '1bto4b' (the DEM tiling script) generates tiles with matching edges, data loaded and passed to models may have “seams,” or regularly-spaced pairs of identical rows and columns. Depending on the data type and model, these seams may or may not cause inaccurate results. The default behavior of the tool is therefore to attempt to correct these seams. Set this property to false to disable this behavior for all sources that do not explicitly set their own 'interpolateSeams' property to true.

descriptionFull.title: Renders dynamic tilesets based on line-of-sight visibilities from user defined source points. DEM tiles are used to generate these. At least one DEM tileset must be configured. curvature is optional and can be set to false to disable using the Major Radius to account for curvature during generations. cameraPresets are optional and the objects within only require the name field.

components.name: Layer specific DEMs
components.description: Only show DEM if associated layer is on.

object.name: Name
object.description: User-friendly name for DEM

components.name: Camera Presets
components.description: Only show DEM if associated layer is on.

object.name: Name
object.description: Camera Name

object.name: Height
object.description: Height in meters

components.name: Curvature
components.description: Whether to account for planetary curvature while computing viewsheds.

Shade.description: Realtime user generated sun and orbiter masks.

descriptionFull.title: Shades the ground when line-of-sights to an orbiting target are occluded.

sources.name: User-friendly name for orbiter or body that 'casts shadows'
sources.value: NAIF SPICE Spacecraft name or ID

observers.name: User-friendly name for observer for spacecraft time computations. Set to null to turn off time converting.

Shade.name: Shade

components.name: DEM path
components.description: A path to a DEM.tif. This is used to get the current center elevation. This can/should be the same file used for the Measure Tool and the Coordinate's elevation.

components.name: Layer specific DEMs
components.description: At minimum, the Shade tool requires at least one 'data' source. A data source describes a DEM tileset (see /auxiliary/gdal2customtiles or /auxiliary/1bto4b) and allows users to select it by name to generate shade maps over.

object.name: Name
object.description: User-friendly name for DEM

components.name: Sources
components.description: An array of objects with the properties 'name' and 'value'. 'name' is the display name for the Source Entity dropdown. 'value' is the SPICE spacecraft ID that gets passed to the backend ll2aerll.py script. Ensure the right kernels for the configured source entities/targets exist in /private/api/spice/kernels.

object.name: Name
object.description: User-friendly name for orbiter or body that 'casts light'

object.name: Value
object.description: NAIF SPICE Spacecraft name or ID

components.name: Observers
components.description: An array of objects with the properties 'name' and 'value'. 'name' is the display name for the Source Entity dropdown. 'value' is the SPICE spacecraft ID that gets passed to the backend chronos.py scripts. Ensure the right kernels for the configured observers exist in /private/api/spice/kernels and that there is a proper chronos setup file for each observer's value private/api/spice/chronosSetups/chronos-{lowercased_observer_value}.setup.

object.name: Name
object.description: User-friendly name for observer for spacecraft time computations

object.name: Value
object.description: NAIF SPICE Spacecraft name or ID

components.name: Default Height
components.description: Sets a default for the 'Height' parameter. Height in meters above the surface to use when calculating line-of-sight shading. For instance, a point on the surface (0m) may not be visible to a 'Source Entity', say the Mars Reconnaissance Orbiter (MRO), but 2m above that point may be. This value does not only apply to the center longitude and latitude but to all points on the visible terrain. Gradually increasing this value shows the shade map n-meters above the surface. The regular default is 0 meters.

components.name: Observer Time Placeholder
components.description: Sets the placeholder information for when the observer time's input box is cleared. Useful for denoting the expected time format to be inputted. For example “SOL DDDD HH:MM:SS”. Default null.

components.name: UTC Time Format
components.description: Sets the placeholder information for when the observer time's input box is cleared. Useful for denoting the expected time format to be inputted. Uses d3 time syntax (https://d3js.org/d3-time-format#locale_format). Example for day-of-year: '%Y-%j %H:%M:%S'. Defaults to times like so: 2023 SEP 06 19:27:05.

Chemistry.description: Display chemistry percentages via graphs of a clicked point.
Chemistry.name: Chemistry

Curtain.description: Curtain views of Ground Penetrating Radar data.

descriptionFull.title: Vertical imagery aligned under terrain for visualizing data from ground penetrating radar.

Curtain.name: Curtain

Kinds.description: Not a real tool but plugin to configure different layer interactions.
Kinds.name: Kinds

Measure.description: Measure distances and generates elevation profiles.

descriptionFull.title: Specify a path to a Digital Elevation Model (dem) .tif. Measure distances and generates elevation profiles. Can also query specific bands at specific points of images and generate profiles of them. If multiple dems are specified, a dropdown will be present for users to toggle between them.

Measure.name: Measure

components.name: DEM path
components.description: Path to a primary DEM (such as Data/defaultDEM.tif). Required if Layer Specific DEMs is unset.

components.name: Layer Specific DEMs
components.description: Object of layer names and the paths to their DEMs. Users may switch between DEMs to profile via a dropdown. The dropdown only renders if there is more than one DEM configured overall.

components.name: Only Show DEM If On
components.description: If true, hides the configured Layer Specific DEMs of off layers from the tool's DEM selection dropdown. If false, all Layer Specific DEMs, even with invalid layer names, always show in the dropdown.

components.name: Default Mode
components.description: Which measurement mode to default to. Options are 'segment', 'continuous' and 'continuous_color'

descriptionFull.title: The Draw tool is an advanced vector data creation and editing tool supporting a multi-user environment. Users can create and manage their own files which can have points, lines, and polygons as well as arrows and text to support annotation. Files can be viewed between users and features copied from one file to another.

example.mtttt: MTTTT endpoint path that overrides MTTTT_HOST env and provides backwards compatibility
example.mttttHostPath: Path to append to MTTTT_HOST env /mttt/sites/JEZ

rows.name: Intent Aliases
rows.description: There are five files that are group editable with the correct permission. The group authentication is set an environment variable in the .env file during startup. These files are meant as collaborative layers that a only a few people will manage and contribute to do to the potential of race conditions on who did the last edit.

components.name: Default Draw Clipping
components.description: Default clipping mode for drawing. Drawing a polygon Over another would clip away that other polygon. Drawing a polygon Under another would have that polygon clip away the newly drawn one. When the clipping mode is Off, no clipping occurs. Users may freely change the clipping mode.

components.name: Leads Can Edit File Info
components.description: If true, lead roles can edit the file info, (name, description, tags, folder, make private) of any user's public file.

components.name: Hover Length On Lines
components.description: If true, the hover text for line features will include the total length of the line in meters.

components.name: Default Public Filter
components.description: When the DrawTool first opens, filter the file list down to only public files or not.

components.name: Default Yours Only Filter
components.description: When the DrawTool first opens, filter the file list down to only files you own or not.

components.name: Default On Filter
components.description: When the DrawTool first opens, filter the file list down to only files that are on or not.

components.name: Default File Property Templates
components.description: Templates create forms for feature properties. For instance, all features in a given draw file could, in the feature's edit panel, have the field “Reviewed” be togglable via a checkbox. Users may make their own templates too but the ones configured here are promoted and cannot be delete.

object.name: Required
object.description: Field requires entry.

object.name: Min Value
object.description: For Slider and Number

object.name: Max Value
object.description: For Slider and Number

object.name: Step Size
object.description: For Slider and Number

object.name: Min Length
object.description: For Text and Textarea

object.name: Max Length
object.description: For Text and Textarea

object.name: Regex
object.description: For Text and Textarea

object.name: Dropdown Items
object.description: Comma-separated. For dropdown

object.name: Date Format
object.description: For date

object.name: Default Value
object.description: For all types

components.name: MTTTT
components.description: MTTTT endpoint path that overrides MTTTT_HOST env and provides backwards compatibility.

components.name: MTTTT Info Link
components.description: Powered by link destination.

components.name: MTTTT Host Path
components.description: Path to append to MTTTT_HOST env /mttt/sites/JEZ.

components.name: MTTTT With Creds
components.description: Only show DEM if associated layer is on.

components.name: Science Intent
components.description: Only show DEM if associated layer is on.
